marketNews.title: CNN reported that Thailand and Cambodia were engaged in cross-border shooting for the second day on Friday (7/25), with more than a dozen people reported killed and over 100,000 civilians evacuated. Tensions between the two countries have been heating up for the past few months, driven by border territorial disputes.
marketNews.content: CNN reported that Thailand and Cambodia were engaged in cross-border shooting for the second day on Friday (7/25), with more than a dozen people reported killed and over 100,000 civilians evacuated. Tensions between the two countries have been heating up for the past few months, driven by border territorial disputes.

marketNews.title: Minister of Economy, Airlangga Hartarto stated that the requirement for TKDN exemption in the trade agreement framework with the US does not apply to all US products. Airlangga explained that this requirement for TKDN exemption is only limited to Information and Communication Technology (ICT) products, data centers, and medical device components. Airlangga also added that these products must still comply with import regulations set by technical ministries and refer to recognition of certification from relevant authorities, such as the Food and Drug Supervisory Agency.
marketNews.content: Minister of Economy, Airlangga Hartarto, on Thursday (7/24) said that the requirement for TKDN exemption in the framework of the trade agreement with the US does not apply to all US products. Airlangga explained that this requirement for TKDN exemption is only limited to Information and Communication Technology (ICT) products, data center, and medical device components. Airlangga also added that these products must still comply with import regulations set by technical ministries and refer to recognition of certification from relevant authorities, for example the Food and Drug Supervisory Agency.

marketNews.title: Minister of Economy, Airlangga Hartarto stated on Thursday (7/24) that there is no removal of Indonesia's critical mineral export ban in the details of the framework for the trade agreement with the US. Airlangga mentioned that Indonesia's mineral export activities must still be based on existing provisions, namely the results of the downstreaming process. Airlangga's statement emerged after the US White House announced that Indonesia agreed to remove restrictions on the export of industrial commodities - including critical minerals - in the trade agreement framework.
marketNews.content: Minister of Economy, Airlangga Hartarto, on Thursday (7/24) stated that there is no removal of Indonesia's critical mineral export ban in the details of the framework of the trade agreement with the US. Airlangga mentioned that Indonesia's mineral export activities must still be based on existing provisions, namely the results of the downstreaming process. Airlangga's statement emerged after the US White House announced that Indonesia agreed to remove restrictions on the export of industrial commodities - including critical minerals - in the trade agreement framework.

marketNews.title: The Indonesian Palm Oil Producers Association (Gapki) estimates that Indonesian palm oil exports will decrease by about -5.1% YoY during 2025 to the level of 28 million tons, driven by increased domestic consumption due to higher biodiesel blending usage, according to a Bloomberg report. The Chairman of Gapki, Eddy Martono, stated that they estimate Indonesian palm oil production will grow +3.7% YoY during 2025 to 50 million tons. Gapki also projects that Indonesian palm oil exports to the US could increase from the level of 2.2 million tons in 2024 to the range of 2.3-2.4 million tons during 2025 if tariffs for this commodity are lowered from the current level of 19%.
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Palm Oil Producers Association (Gapki) estimates that Indonesian palm oil exports will decrease by about -5.1% YoY during 2025 to the level of 28 million tons as domestic consumption increases due to higher biodiesel blending usage, according to a Bloomberg report. The Chairman of Gapki, Eddy Martono, mentioned that they estimate Indonesian palm oil production will grow +3.7% YoY during 2025 to 50 million tons. Gapki also estimates that Indonesian palm oil exports to the US could increase from the level of 2.2 million tons in 2024 to the range of 2.3-2.4 million tons during 2025 if tariffs for this commodity are lowered from the level of 19%.

tickerNews.title: BNI 1H25: Net Profit -6% YoY, Below Expectations - Net Interest Margin Guidance Lowered to Minimum 3.8%
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) recorded net profit of 4.7 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (-12% YoY, -12% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 10.1 trillion rupiah (-6% YoY), below expectations as it was only equivalent to 46% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. the average of the last 2 years: 50% annual realization). Net Profit Suppressed by Weak PPOP and Increased Provisions. Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) decreased by -5%/-2% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, along with Non-Interest Income which fell -2%/-3% YoY in 2Q25/1H25 amidst an opex increase of +5%/+3% YoY. Net Interest Income was relatively better, still up +0%/+2% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, although far below credit growth of +7% YoY as of June 2025, highlighting pressure on margins. The Net Interest Margin (NIM) in 2Q25 dropped to 3.7% (vs. 2Q24: 4%, 1Q25: 3.9%) due to high Cost of Fund, causing the NIM position in 1H25 to be at the level of 3.8% (vs. 1H24: 4%). Asset Quality. Provision expenses increased to 2 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+15% YoY, +15% QoQ), resulting in total provision expenses for 1H25 reaching 3.8 trillion rupiah (+8% YoY). The NPL ratio itself stood at 1.9% in 2Q25 (vs. 2Q24: 2%, 1Q25: 2%), with the consumer segment experiencing an NPL increase to 2.1% (vs. 2Q24: 1.6%, 1Q25: 2%). This increase was mainly seen in the mortgage and auto financing sub-segments, which management attributed to weakened purchasing power. Involvement in Koperasi Desa Merah Putih. BBNI management did not provide a complete explanation regarding the company's involvement in Koperasi Desa Merah Putih. However, management stated that discussions with the government accommodated the interests of all stakeholders. In credit disbursement, the bank will carry out the assessment process for potential debtors, and the portion of credit disbursed is considered to still be manageable. Key Takeaway. The weakening performance in 2Q25 is in line with indications we wrote previously. Post-release of 1H25 performance, BBNI management lowered the NIM guidance for 2025 from the range of 4-4.2% to a minimum of 3.8%. This cut was made even though management forecasts that banking liquidity conditions will improve in 2H25 along with: 1) a decrease in SRBI yield and holdings; 2) a decrease in BI interest rates; and 3) acceleration of government spending. Meanwhile, guidance for credit growth (+8-10% YoY) and Cost of Credit (~1%) remained unchanged.

tickerNews.title: PANI Clarifies Rights Issue Rumor: Denies Official Statement on Year-End Rights Issue Plan
tickerNews.content: PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua stated in clarification to the IDX on Thursday (7/24) that the company has never provided an official statement or response to the media regarding rumors of holding a rights issue by the end of this year. PANI also affirmed that as of the date this clarification letter was made, the company had never stated a plan to conduct a rights issue. PANI's statement emerged after Bloomberg Technoz on Wednesday (7/23) reported that PANI would hold a rights issue with an exercise price of 20,000 rupiah per share in December 2025, with the company reportedly to announce it soon. PANI explained in its clarification that the company is always open to all possibilities and alternatives regarding corporate actions - including rights issues - to support the company's expansion plans and business continuity.

tickerNews.title: UNTR: Komatsu Heavy Equipment Sales Reached 379 Units in June 2025, 1H25 Cumulative Sales at 2,728 Units (+27.1% YoY)
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (UNTR) recorded sales of Komatsu brand heavy equipment totaling 379 units in June 2025 (-18.1% MoM, -2.8% YoY). Cumulatively during 1H25, Komatsu sales reached 2,728 units (+27.1% YoY), equivalent to 59% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with market share stable at 26% (vs. 5M25: 26%, 1H24: 28%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 68.4 million tons (-1.6% YoY) during 1H25, with overburden removal at 532.8 million bcm (-9.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BTPS: BTPN Syariah Bank 1H25 Net Profit Up +17% YoY to 644 Billion Rupiah, Supported by Lower Provision Expenses
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah (BTPS) recorded net profit of 333 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+16% YoY, +7.2% QoQ), marking the highest quarterly profit since 2Q23. This result brought the net profit for 1H25 up +17% YoY to 644 billion rupiah, in line with expectations (51% of the 2025F consensus estimate, 1H24: 52% annual realization). The increase in net profit was driven by a decrease in provision expenses by -41% YoY in 2Q25 and -42% YoY during 1H25, with Cost of Credit dropping to 7.8% in 2Q25 (vs. 2Q24: 12.7%, 1Q25: 8.5%) and 8.2% during 1H25 (vs. 1H24: 13.3%). Meanwhile, Gross NPF decreased to the level of 3.1% from year-end position, although still higher compared to the same period last year (vs. 4Q24: 3.7%, 2Q24: 3%). PPOP still decreased by -13% YoY during 1H25, along with Net Margin Income which weakened by -4.9% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DMAS: 1H25 Marketing Sales Reach 580 Billion Rupiah (-47% YoY), Driven by Data Center Sector Sales
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari (DMAS) recorded marketing sales of 114 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-79% YoY, -76% QoQ). This result brought the marketing sales for 1H25 to 580 billion rupiah (-47% YoY), equivalent to ~32% of the 2025 target of 1.81 trillion rupiah. Director & Corporate Secretary of DMAS, Tondy Suwanto, stated that the company recorded industrial land sales of 18 hectares during 1H25 (vs. 1H24: 34 hectares, 1Q25: 14.2 hectares). Tondy mentioned that the data center sector was the main driver of 1H25 marketing sales, contributing 69%. Tondy also revealed that there is still industrial land demand of ~75 hectares, dominated by the data center sector at more than 50%.

tickerNews.title: IPCC: 1H25 Net Profit Spikes +41% YoY to 114 Billion Rupiah, Supported by Gross Margin Expansion to 43.2%
tickerNews.content: Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal (IPCC) recorded net profit of 63 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+48% YoY, +22% QoQ), resulting in net profit for 1H25 reaching 114 billion rupiah (+41% YoY). Revenue in 2Q25 grew to 212 billion rupiah (+15% YoY, +4% QoQ), resulting in revenue for 1H25 growing +15% YoY to 416 billion rupiah. Besides revenue, the solid net profit growth in 2Q25 was mainly driven by gross profit margin expansion which rose to the level of 43.2% (vs. 2Q24: 35.4%, 1Q25: 38.2%), causing gross profit to grow +40% YoY, +18% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: Hidrogen Peroxida Indonesia (Subsidiary of SGER and previously mentioned BSMR) Signs Syndicated Credit Agreement Change from 160 Billion Rupiah to 350 Billion Rupiah, with Option to Increase to 600 Billion Rupiah for H2O2 Plant Development
tickerNews.content: Subsidiary of Sumber Global Energy (SGER) and Bintang Mitra Semestaraya (BSMR), PT Hidrogen Peroxida Indonesia, signed a change to the syndicated credit agreement from 160 billion rupiah to 350 billion rupiah, with an option to increase to 600 billion rupiah. This loan is intended for the development of the second largest hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) plant in Indonesia with a production capacity of 20 thousand metric tons per year.

tickerNews.title: NRCA Shareholding Change: Commissioner Johannes Suriadjaja Sells ~1.8 Million Shares, PT Persada Capital Investama Buys 4 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Chief Commissioner of Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA), Johannes Suriadjaja, sold ~1.8 million NRCA shares at an average price of 1,015 rupiah per share on July 21, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~1.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Johannes Suriadjaja's ownership in NRCA decreased from 0.15% to 0.08%. On the same day, PT Persada Capital Investama bought 4 million NRCA shares at an average price of 815 rupiah per share or totaling ~3.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Persada Capital Investama's ownership in NRCA increased from none to 0.16%.
